alert.note: Alert for Claiborne (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 03 at 4:19PM CST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Claiborne and Jefferson Counties through 515 PM CST... At 418 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Stampley, or 16 miles northeast of Natchez, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Fayette and Mcnair around 430 PM CST. Lorman around 440 PM CST. Red Lick around 445 PM CST. Blue Hill around 450 PM CST. Pattison around 455 PM CST. Peyton and Mcbride around 500 PM CST. Hermanville around 505 PM CST. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 500 PM CST for central and southwestern Mississippi.
